property.name: Quote
property.value: "The credits have been completed in an entirely different style at great expense and at the last minute."

property.name: Alternative Text

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Save a Knight from death but he must Sit Out 2 turns.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "And spank me." "And me." "And meâ€¦" "Yes, yes. You must give us all a good spanking!" "A spanking! A spanking! There's going to be a spanking tonight!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Duck automatically attacks the Knight with the lowest Combat value.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Ifâ€¦. she... Weighs the same as a duckâ€¦ she's made of wood." "And therefore?" "A witch! A witch!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Opponent's Knights may not have Combat this turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Please! This is supposed to be a happy occasion! Let's not bicker and argue about who killed who."

property.name: Alternative Text
property.value: "{or: Player must double Ante. [or Eliminate the top two cards of their deck and two more for each Aint Heard Nothing and A Herring in the Dead Cart if not playing for Ante]}"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Place in the Dead Cart to bypass the Knights-Who-'Til-Recently-Said-Ni or to remove the Mightiest Tree in the Forest from play.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "You must cut down the mightiest tree in the forest withâ€¦ a herring!" "We shall do no such thing!" "Oh, please!" "Cut down a tree with a herring? It can't be done."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Permanently lower the Wits vvalue of target Knight to 1.

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Prevent opponent from playing a Taunt from their hand. Place the Taunt in the Dead Cart.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Let us taunt it! It may become so cross that it will make a mistake." "Like what?"

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Mynd you, moose bites kan be pretti nastiâ€¦"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Choose a member of opponent's Round Table to be turned into a Newt. Draw a Grail Number to determine the number of turns that member is Eliminated.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Well, she turned me into a newt!" "A newt?" "I got better."

property.name: Alternative Text
property.value: "{or: prevent opponent from moving this turn.}"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Place A Note in the Dead Cart to retract any one movement after the Face-down cards have been revealed. Instead of making the original movement, the player's Round Table may move elsewhere.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "You got my note!" "Well, I got A note."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Take a card from opponent and play it immediately or place it in the Dead Cart.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Sir! I have a plan." "What happens now?" "Well, now, Lancelot, Galahad, and I wait until nightfall, and then leap out of the rabbit, taking the French by surprise. Not only by surprise, but totally unarmed!" "Who leaps out?"

property.name: Alternative Text
property.value: "{or: Save a Knight from death but with a Permanent -2 penalty to Combat}"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Permanently lower the Combat value of target Knight by 2. May be played with Flesh Wound.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Now stand aside, worthy adversary." " 'Tis but a scratch." "A scratch? Your arm's off!" "No, it isn't." "Well, what's that then?" "I've had worse." "You lie!" "Come on, you pansy!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Knights may not enter or pass this Castle.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Well, on second thought, let's not go to Camelot. It is a silly place." "Right." "Right."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Play on a Village or Castle. Knights may not leave this Village or Castle for one turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "A spanking! A spanking!" "You must spank her well. And after you have spanked her, you may deal with her as you like. And then, spank me."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Search your deck for the Killer Rabbit and reshuffle.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "That's the most foul, cruel and bad tempered rodent you've ever set eyes on." "What's he do? Nibble your bum?" "He'll do you up a treat!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Will not occupy a Castle. Witch turns one Knight into a Newt for a Grail Number draw of turns. Witch chooses the Knight.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Well, she turned me into a newt!" "A newt?" "I got better."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Knights may not enter or pass a Castle for one turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "I burst my pimples at you and call your door-opening request a silly thing."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: "Opponent's Knights may not have Wits with Adversary, Knight, or Persona."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "So you think you could outclever us French folk with your silly knees bent running about advancing behavior."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Special Combat: Every time African Swallow is in the same space as opponent's Round Table, a coconut drops on a Knight's head of opponent's choice causing a Permanent -1 to Combat. You may move the African Swallow one space during opponent's turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Oh, yeah, an African swallow may be, but not a European swallow. That's my point."

property.name: Alternative Text
property.value: "{or: swallow drops a coconut on opponent. +1 to a Combat draw}"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Player's Round Table may not move this turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "The swallow may fly south with the sun, or the house martin or the plover seek warmer climes in winter, yet these are not strangers to our land."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Player must double Ante (or Eliminate the top two cards from their deck and two more for each Ain't Heard Nothing or Herring in your Dead Cart if not playing for Ante).

property.name: Quote

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Go and tell your master that we have been charged by God with a sacred quest; if he will give us food an shelter for the night, he may join us in our quest for the Holy Grail." "Well, I'll ask him but I don't think he'll be very keen. He's already got one, you see."

property.value: "And don't apologize. Every time I try to talk to someone it's 'sorry' this, and 'forgive me' that, and 'I'm not worthy.' What are you doing now?" "I'm averting my eyes, O Lord!" "Well, don't!"

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Shut up, will you shut up?!" "Ah, now we see the violence inheretent in the system! Help! Help! I'm being repressed!" "Bloody Peasant!"

A Knight(s) attempting to enter this village is subject to a random event determined by a Grail Number draw. 1 or less: +1 to the next Round Table draw. 2: Search the deck for Sir Bedevere and reshuffle. 3: Search the deck for Extra Coconuts and reshuffle. 4: No event. 5: Draw an extra card next turn during the draw phase. 6+: -2 to your next Wits draw.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Since her own father, who, when he seemed about to recover, suddenly felt the icy hand of death upon him." "Uugh!" "Oh, he's died!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: May be used to freely cross any area in England except the Sea of Fate. Opponent may search deck for 1 Questions Three for each Knight crossing and play them immediately. If played over the Gorge of Eternal Peril, the Knights who fail to correctly answer the questions are cast into the Gorge and placed in the Dead Cart. Personae or extra pages cannot cross the Bridge of Death, place them in the Dead Cart.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "There it is, the Bridge of Death!" "Oh, great." "Look! There's the old man from scene twenty-four!" "What's he doing here?" "He is the keeper of the Bridge of Death. He asks each traveler five questions--" "Three questions." "Three questions. He who answers the five questions--" "Three questions." "Three questions may cross in safety."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Will not occupy a Castle. Opponent of player who encounters Bridgekeeper may search deck for as many Questions Three cards as encountering player has Knights.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Stop! Who would cross the Bridge of Death must answer me these questions three. Ere the other side he see."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Reshuffle your Dead Cart back into your deck. Eliminate Bring Out Your Dead.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Bring out your dead!" (CLANG!) "Bringout your dead!" "Here's one." "Ninepence." "Here's your ninepence." "I'm not dead!" " 'Ereâ€¦ He says he's not dead!" "Yes he is." "I'm not!" "He isn't?" "Well, he will be soon. He's very ill." "I'm getting better!" No, you're not. You'll be stone dead in a moment."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: One time only, may search through deck for either Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch or Arcane Writing.

property.name: Card Text

property.name: Quote
property.value: "And the Lord spake, saying, 'First shalt thou take out the Holy Pin. Then, shalt thau count to three, no more, no less. Three shalt be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be threeâ€¦"

property.name: Quote

property.name: Card Text
property.value: +7 Combat to occupant. Lose a turn, but draw 7 extra cards during the following draw phase. A Knight(s) attempting to enter this Castle is subject to a random event determined by a Grail Number draw. 1 or less: "The Fiends!" Defenders use farm animals. Lose a Knight. 2: "Fetchez la vache!" "Moooo!" Lose a Page. 3: On the wrong end of a nasty taunting. Lose a Persona. 4-7: "No chance, bedwetting types!" Knights may not pass. 8-10: "African swallows are non-migratory." Knights may pass. 11: "Well, can we come up and have a look?" Knights may enter and recieve any benefits from the Castle. 12+: "Oh. Alright." Knights may enter and invite the Castle occupant to join the Round Table unless they are an Adversary or Peril.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Well, on second thought, let's not go to Camelot. It is a silly place."

property.value: "Brave, brave Concorde, you shall not have died in vain." "I'm not quite dead, sir."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Not to leave the room even if you come and get him." "No, no. Until I come and get him."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Tell me, what do you do with witches?" "Burn them!" "And what do you burn apart from witches?" "More witches!" "Shhh!" "Wood?" "So why do witches burn?"

property.value: A Knight defeated by Crapper in a Village or Castle may not leave that Village or Castle until Crapper is defeated by another Knight. May be played with other Anthrax characters.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Oh, but you are tired and must rest awhile. Midget! Crapper!" "Yes, O Zoot?" "Prepare a bed for our guest."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Now we see the violence inherent in the system."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "At last! A call! A cry of distress! This could be the sign that leads us to the Holy Grail! Brave, brave Concorde, you shall not have died in vain!" "Uh, I'm--I'm not quite dead, sir!"

property.name: Quote
property.value: "No, no. 'Aauuuuugh,' at the back of the throat." "Aauuugh."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Are you suggesting coconuts migrage?" "Not at all. They could be carried." "What? A swallow carrying a coconut?" "It could grip it by the husk!"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Delay the effect of any Taunt cards played this turn until next turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Is there someone else up there we could talk to?"

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Force opponent to redraw a draw made to find the Holy Grail.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Look, please! In God's name, show me the grail!" "Oh, you have suffered much. You are delirious."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Will not occupy a Castle. If a Knight has wits with Dennis and loses, draw a Grail Number. 2 or less: Cannot pass this space. 3: lose a turn. 4-5: Knight becomes a Page. 6+: Place Knight in the Dead Cart.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Oh, King, eh? Very nice. And how did you get that, eh? By exploiting the working class! By 'anging on to outdated imperialist dogma which perpetuates the economic and social differences in our society."

property.value: TYAST Deck B, TYAST Deck D

property.name: Alternative Text

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Yes, depart a lot this time, and cut the approaching any more or we will fire arrows at the tops of your heads and make castanets out of your testicles already!"

property.name: Card Text

property.name: Quote
property.value: "You can't expect to wield supreme executive power just 'cause some watery tart threw a sword at you!"

property.name: Card Text

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Yes, yes. You must give us all a good spanking."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: Choose a Champion to combat opponent's Champion for 1 turn.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Brave Sir Robin, you go." "Hey, I've got an idea. Why doesn't Lancelot go?" "Yes, let me go, my liege. I will take him single-handedâ€¦ I shall make a feint to the northeast thatâ€¦"

property.name: Card Text

property.name: Quote

property.name: Quote
property.value: "The thing is, I thought you son was a lady." "Well, I can understand that."

property.value: "Who had nearly fought the Dragon of Angnor."

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Almighty God, we thank Thee that Thou has vouchsafed to us the most Holyâ€¦" (TWONG!!) "Jesus Christ!"

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Quickly, sir! Come this way!" "No! It's not right for my idiom! I must escape moreâ€¦" "Dramatically, sir?" "Dramatically!"

property.value: "All right, we'll call it a draw." "Oh, oh. I see. Running away, eh? You yellow bastards! Come back here and take what's coming to you? I'll bit your legs off!"

property.value: +4 Combat to occupant. Draw 3 extra cards during draw phase. Eliminate Swamp Castle after 3 turns (it sank into the swamp). May be played in the same space as The Tall Tower. A Knight(s) attempting to enter this Castle is subject to a random event determined by a Grail Number draw. 1 or less: "The Fiends!" Defenders use farm animals. Lose a Knight. 2: "Fetchez la vache!" "Moooo!" Lose a Page. 3: On the wrong end of a nasty taunting. Lose a Persona. 4-7: "No chance, bedwetting types!" Knights may not pass. 8-10: "African swallows are non-migratory." Knights may pass. 11: "Well, can we come up and have a look?" Knights may enter and recieve any benefits from the Castle. 12+: "Oh. Alright." Knights may enter and invite the Castle occupant to join the Round Table unless they are an Adversary or Peril.

property.name: Quote

property.value: Opponent must immediately finish their drink or their Knights are forced into combat and may not Run Away.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Your mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries."

property.name: Card Text
property.value: A Knight defeated by Zoot in a Village or Castle may not leave that Village or Castle until Zoot is defeated by another Knight. May be played with other Anthrax characters.

property.name: Quote
property.value: "Oh, wicked, bad, naughty Zoot! Oh, wicked, bad, naughty, evil Zoot!"
